title: Improve compiler output when incorrect enum variant name is given.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
pub enum JwtResponseDto {
    AccessToken,
    2FAChallenge,
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected identifier, found `2FAChallenge`
 --> src/main.rs:7:5
  |
5 | pub enum JwtResponseDto {
  |          -------------- while parsing this enum
6 |     AccessToken,
7 |     2FAChallenge,
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected identifier
  |
  = help: enum variants can be `Variant`, `Variant = <integer>`, `Variant(Type, ..., TypeN)` or `Variant { fields: Types }`

error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```


### Desired output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: expected identifier, found `2FAChallenge`
 --> src/main.rs:7:5
  |
5 | pub enum JwtResponseDto {
  |          -------------- while parsing this enum
6 |     AccessToken,
7 |     2FAChallenge,
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected identifier
  |
  = help: enum variants can be `Variant`, `Variant = <integer>`, `Variant(Type, ..., TypeN)` or `Variant { fields: Types }`
  = hint: enum variants cannot start with a number

error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```


### Rationale and extra context

_No response_

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

It's a very small nitpick, but given Rust's excellent error messages I thought it might be worth to consider adding this one.
